summary: Completed frontend testing of 4 appointment card changes: Priority flag, status badge removal from header, N-1 popup dialog, and N-1 full Day Outcome logic for tomorrow's appointments. All features verified working correctly.

issues: Console warning: Missing `Description` or `aria-describedby={undefined}` for {DialogContent} - minor accessibility issue

passed_tests: Priority flag shows in Status sidebar for Today's appointments (apt_up_101)
Priority flag shows in Status sidebar for Tomorrow's appointments (apt_up_105)
Priority flag shows in Status sidebar for Future appointments (appt_a4b0f6271251)
Status badge (Booked/Confirmed/No-show) removed from appointment card header - header only shows booking ID and [R] badge
Today's appointment (apt_up_101, 2026-02-14): shows Day Outcome, N-1, Docket Ready, Priority, OTS, Lost Customer
Tomorrow's appointment (apt_up_105, 2026-02-15): shows N-1 Confirmation with full Day Outcome logic, Docket Ready, Priority, OTS, Lost Customer. NO Day Outcome field.
Future appointment (appt_a4b0f6271251, 2026-02-20): shows only OTS, Priority, Lost Customer. NO Day Outcome, N-1, Docket Ready.
N-1 popup dialog in Upcoming Tomorrow table: Rescheduled opens popup with date picker + remarks textarea
N-1 popup dialog in Upcoming Tomorrow table: Cancelled opens popup with reason textarea
N-1 status: Confirmed, Pending, Not Reachable update directly without popup (toast confirmation shown)
Day Outcome in edit mode: Rescheduled shows conditional reschedule date + remarks fields
N-1 Confirmation in tomorrow's edit mode: has dropdown with full options (Pending, Confirmed, Not Reachable, Rescheduled, Cancelled)
N-1 Confirmation in tomorrow's edit mode: Rescheduled shows conditional reschedule date + remarks fields
critical_code_review_comments: StatusSidebar.jsx properly implements conditional field visibility based on isToday/isTomorrow/isTodayOrTomorrow
OutcomeField component is well-designed as reusable for both Day Outcome and N-1 Confirmation
N-1 popup in Upcoming.jsx correctly differentiates between Rescheduled (date+remarks) and Cancelled (reason only)
Priority flag correctly placed between OTS and Lost Customer in the flags section
seed_data_creation: None - used existing appointments: apt_up_101 (today), apt_up_105 (tomorrow), appt_a4b0f6271251 (future 2026-02-20)
context_for_next_testing_agent: 4 appointment card features verified: 1) Priority flag added to Status sidebar (visible for all appointment types), 2) Status badge removed from header (only booking ID and [R] badge shown), 3) N-1 popup dialog in Upcoming Tomorrow table works for Rescheduled/Cancelled, 4) N-1 Confirmation on tomorrow's appointment detail has full Day Outcome logic with conditional reschedule/cancel fields. Today's date is 2026-02-14, tomorrow is 2026-02-15.

priority_flag.description: Priority flag visible in Status sidebar for all appointment types (Today, Tomorrow, Future)

status_badge_removed.description: Header only shows booking ID (e.g., #SILB0101) and [R] badge if rescheduled. Status badges like Booked/Confirmed/No-show are NOT in header.

fields_shown: N-1 Confirmation (with full Day Outcome logic)

n1_popup_dialog.direct_update: Confirmed, Pending, Not Reachable update without popup

n1_full_day_outcome_logic.description: N-1 Confirmation on tomorrow's appointment detail (edit mode) has dropdown with conditional reschedule/cancel fields same as Day Outcome
